about.title: About DUNE
paragraphs: The Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) is a leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and proton decay studies. The DUNE Training Experience Hub provides resources, training, and collaboration opportunities for researchers, students, and enthusiasts interested in neutrino physics and the DUNE experiment.
Based at Rice University, this hub serves as a central access point for DUNE-related tools, datasets, and educational resources.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: Meet the researchers and developers behind the DUNE Training Experience Hub.

services.title: DUNE Services
services.subtitle: Access key DUNE services and resources to support your research and learning.

mainServices.title: DUNE Catalog
mainServices.description: Query and access datasets from the DUNE Metacat database. Find experiment data, analysis results, and more.
mainServices.details: The DUNE Catalog provides a user-friendly interface to search, filter, and download datasets from the DUNE experiment. Access metadata, file locations, and dataset descriptions to accelerate your research.

mainServices.title: JupyterHub
mainServices.description: Run Jupyter notebooks on the Rice DUNE server with pre-configured environments for data analysis.
mainServices.details: JupyterHub provides a collaborative environment for data analysis, visualization, and machine learning. Access computing resources, shared libraries, and DUNE datasets directly from your browser.

additionalServices.title: Training Workshops
additionalServices.description: Comprehensive workshops on neutrino physics, detector technology, and data analysis.

additionalServices.title: Documentation
additionalServices.description: Access to educational materials, publications, and learning resources for all levels.

aboutNeutrinos.title: About Neutrinos
aboutNeutrinos.subtitle: Learn about these fascinating subatomic particles and why they're important to physics.
